sentence.Network_en: He reached oratorical heights which left him and some of his players in tears.
sentence.Network_cn: 演讲到言辞激昂之处，他自己和他指导的一些运动员不禁热泪盈眶。

sentence.Network_en: The award for the oratorical contest was made by a jury of nine professors.
sentence.Network_cn: 演讲比赛的裁决由九位教授组成的评判委员会作出.

sentence.Network_en: His oratorical efforts evoked no response in his audience.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的雄辩在听众中不起反响.

...Saturnalia）中包括了一部名符其实的古罗马妙语集，以及其他等等。但是最重要的著作是西塞罗的《论演说家》（De oratore），这部著作不仅引用了许多趣闻轶事，也对诙谐与幽默做了一番透彻的分析。它对后世的作家产生了非常大的影响.

entry.def: Oratorical means relating to or using oratory.

example.ex: He reached oratorical heights which left him and some of his players in tears.
example.tran: 演讲到言辞激昂之处，他自己和他指导的一些运动员不禁热泪盈眶。

means.word_mean: 1. characteristic of an orator or oratory;

sentences.sentence: "harangued his men in an oratorical way"- Robert Graves

auth_sentence.content: One of his rolling oratorical utterances.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One of his rolling oratorical utterances.

auth_sentence.content: We may not be able to change the world, he declaims, raising an oratorical finger, but we can change our local community.
auth_sentence.res_content: We may not be able to change the world, he declaims, raising an oratorical finger, but we can change our local community.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We may not be able to change the world, he declaims, raising an oratorical finger, but we can change our local community.

auth_sentence.content: He often seems to have had more at stake, and certainly more oratorical energy, than anyone in the government.
auth_sentence.res_content: He often seems to have had more at stake, and certainly more oratorical energy, than anyone in the government.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He often seems to have had more at stake, and certainly more oratorical energy, than anyone in the government.
